[Portrait]Folmarv
[Dialog]<Ramza>, at last we meet!

Pray forgive me. I ought to have called
upon you sooner, but I have been ever
so busy of late.
I fear I remain so even now, so let us
make this brief.

If you would see your sister returned
alive, you will relinquish the Scriptures
and all the auracite you possess.
Refuse, and she dies ere the word
leaves your lips.

Are we of an understanding?
My patience is grown thin.{END}

I have what you desire.
Where is Alma?

I surrender naught until
she is brought before me.{END}

Did you not hear a word I said?
I offered no negotiable terms.

Forfeit the Scriptures and the Stones,
or forfeit your sister's life.{END}

Here are the Scriptures. The Stones
I hold until I see that she is safe.{END}

Well...?{END}

[Portrait]Loffrey
[Dialog]...It is written here. A surprisingly
simple incantation.{END}

Excellent. Then we have all we need of
them.

Of course, I suppose propriety dictates
that we venge Belias and the others
while they're here.{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]We are deceived!{END}

[Portrait]Meliadoul
[Dialog]Are you truly the father
I've always known?{END}

[Portrait]Folmarv
[Dialog]Of course I am, child!

Why do you fight on their side?
When did you turn against your
own kin?{END}

When my own kin ceased to be
the man he once was.{END}

Whatever do you mean?{END}

The marquis Elmdore de Limberry
was made some sort of fiend when
he used a Zodiac Stone.
And at Riovanes-the monster who
killed Isilud and all the others was you,
wasn't it?{END}

Monster? You think us monsters!?{END}

Then it's true! You are
not my father.{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]Why did you not kill Alma?{END}

[Portrait]Folmarv
[Dialog]What do you mean?{END}

You took no pause in slaughtering
your own son. Why keep my sister
alive?{END}

Our affairs are not for you to know!{END}

[Portrait]Folmarv
[Dialog]Hmph. We will serve our
vengeance another day.{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>
[Dialog]They are even more craven
than I'd thought!{END}
